lead_paragraph: An estimated 687,000 drug users have turned themselves in since President Rodrigo Duterte took office, but the government is proving unprepared to assist them.

byline.contributor: Felipe Villamor and Raul Alibutud contributed reporting.

headline.print_headline: In the Philippines’ Drug War, Little Help Is Given to Those Who Surrender
headline.main: In Philippine Drug War, Little Help for Those Who Surrender

snippet: An estimated 687,000 drug users have turned themselves in since President Rodrigo Duterte took office, but the government is proving unprepared to assist them....
abstract: Violent war on drugs launched in Philippines by Pres Rodrigo Duterte has prompted some 687,000 people to turn themselves in to authorities, but government has proven unprepared to help vast number of repentant addicts seeking help, leaving many to battle addiction on their own; vast need has created new crisis for Duterte, even as he presses ahead with bloody campaign.
